definition: a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Anything else is a sham, a pale imitation.
sentences.chinese: 別的都是騙局，都是蒼白的仿製品。

sentences.english: Deception Point is pulse-pounding fiction at its best.
sentences.chinese: 《大騙局》是讓脈搏狂飆的登峯造極之作。

sentences.english: Seeing as there's no proof besides their word, take it as a hoax.
sentences.chinese: 沒有證據證明認爲這是一個騙局。

sentences.english: Madoff made it seem impossibly difficult to invest with him.
sentences.chinese: 麥道夫令他的騙局看起來極困難入局。

sentences.english: The Cardiff Giant is one of the most famous hoaxes in American history.
sentences.chinese: 卡蒂夫巨人是美國曆史上最有名的騙局之一。

sentences.english: Here s an example of a classical swindle.
sentences.chinese: 下面是一個經典的騙局例子。

sentences.english: Their scam is selling fake Chinese medicine to old people.
sentences.chinese: 他們的騙局是賣假中藥給老人。

sentences.english: We have what I called, "the great deception".
sentences.chinese: 我們正在經歷我所謂的“大騙局。

sentences.english: Here we've gathered the top 10 science hoaxes of all time.
sentences.chinese: 這裏，我們收集了，有史以來最出名的十大科學騙局。

sentences.english: And Americans, it seems, have seen through the deception.
sentences.chinese: 不過，美國人民似乎已經看穿了這場騙局。

sentences.english: Ava caught on to Errol and his tricks.
sentences.chinese: 埃娃看穿了埃羅爾和他的騙局。

sentences.english: Withjust two months until tet, giap plays what might be his greatest deception.
sentences.chinese: 還有兩個月就到春節了，武元甲設計了一個驚天騙局。

sentences.english: The colleagues who perpetrated the hoax lost their jobs and reputations over the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 那些設計騙局的同事則既丟了工作又因醜聞毀了名聲。

sentences.english: Perhaps the fraud revealed at the beginning of the year should have been a tip-off.
sentences.chinese: 或許騙局在年初就應該得到昭示。

sentences.english: After all it was a ruse of the Thenardiers to obtain money. Cosette was not ill.
sentences.chinese: 那卻是德納第夫婦謀財的騙局，珂賽特並沒有害病。

definition: to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
